text.p: Here are highlights of stories in Romania's press on Monday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy:
- Romania's interbank market will be liberalised starting February 18, the paper says.
- Compaq computer manufacturer plans to open representative office in Romania.
- Romania's air force will get another two Hercules C 130 aircraft.
- SNCFR railway authority raised tariffs for passenger and freight transport starting Monday.
- Minimum monthly wage was set at 150,000 lei after talks between government and trade unions.
- Companies might resort to road freight transport after hike in railway tariffs, the paper says.
- Traffic on Danube-Black Sea canal rose by 12.5 percent in 1996.
- Costs related to Romania's integration into NATO could amount to up to $10 billion, Defence Minister Victor Babiuc quoted as saying.
